means: 性情乖僻地，酸酸地，坏心眼地

sentence.Network_en: "Leave my mother out of it," he said sourly.
sentence.Network_cn: “不要把我母亲搅进去，”他没好气地说。

sentence.Network_en: They looked at me sourly at first.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们最初不高兴地看着我.

sentence.Network_en: Madame Bron, who had been thirty years in the theatre, replied quite sourly.
sentence.Network_cn: 勃龙太太在这剧院里服务了三十年了, 回答得十分酸刻.

PerfectNetExp.abs: sourish 微酸的sourly 酸酸地sourness 酸味
he complained sourly that the new rules only benefitted the managers .他尖刻地抱怨说新规定只对管理人员有好处。
sourjujube 酸枣, sourly 性情乖僻地, sourlier 苏利耶
" talkers , " someone had sourly called them thirty years before .三十年前有人刻薄地称他们为“废话连篇的空谈家。”

list.abs: They looked at me sourly at first ., 他们最初不高兴地看着我.
The black bile , sourly bitter , rose in Bonasera ' s throat , overflowed through tightly clenched teeth ., 黑胆汁 , 坏心眼地苦涩 , 上升博纳塞拉的喉咙 , 咬紧牙关 , 通过严格溢出.

entry.def: Something that is sour has a sharp, unpleasant taste like the taste of a lemon.

example.ex: The stewed apple was sour even with honey.
example.tran: 炖煮的苹果即便加了蜂蜜还是很酸。

entry.def: Sour milk is milk that has an unpleasant taste because it is no longer fresh.

entry.tran: (人)乖戾的，尖酸刻薄的，不友好的
entry.def: Someone who is sour is bad-tempered and unfriendly.

example.ex: She made a sour face in his direction...
Police, weary and increasingly sour in mood, wonder aloud why the situation has been allowed to deteriorate.
example.tran: 警察们疲惫不堪，心情也越来越糟糕，他们不禁满腹狐疑地问：为什么听凭情况不断地恶化下去？

entry.tran: (状况、关系等)变坏，变糟，不再令人满意
entry.def: If a situation or relationship turns sour or goes sour, it stops being enjoyable or satisfactory.

example.ex: Everything turned sour for me there...
example.tran: 在那里，对我来说一切变得很不顺利。

example.ex: Even the European dream is beginning to turn sour...
example.tran: 甚至连欧洲之梦都开始破灭了。

entry.tran: (使)(友谊、局势、态度等)变坏;(使)恶化
entry.def: If a friendship, situation, or attitude sours or if something sours it, it becomes less friendly, enjoyable, or hopeful.

example.ex: If anything sours the relationship, it is likely to be real differences in their world-views...
example.tran: 如果有什么东西能够破坏这种关系的话，那可能就是他们世界观方面存在的实质性差异。

entry.tran: 酸葡萄(喻指由于得不到而加以贬低的东西)
entry.def: If you refer to someone's attitude as sour grapes, you mean that they say that something is worthless or undesirable because they want it themselves but cannot have it.

example.ex: Page's response to the suggestion that this might be sour grapes because his company lost the bid is: 'Life's too short for that.'
example.tran: 有人认为这是佩奇的酸葡萄心理在作怪，因为他的公司未能中标，佩奇对此的回应是：“人生苦短，谁有闲工夫去耿耿于怀呢？”

sentences.sentence: "he complained sourly that the new rules only benefitted the managers"

auth_sentence.content: The old soda bottles, lottery tickets and newspaper clippings had them sourly perplexed.
auth_sentence.res_content: The old soda bottles, lottery tickets and newspaper clippings had them sourly perplexed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The old soda bottles, lottery tickets and newspaper clippings had them sourly perplexed.

auth_sentence.content: Self-pity is a natural component of grief, of a roused sense of mortality, but in Dianamania it sourly predominated.
auth_sentence.res_content: Self-pity is a natural component of grief, of a roused sense of mortality, but in Dianamania it sourly predominated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Self-pity is a natural component of grief, of a roused sense of mortality, but in Dianamania it sourly predominated.
